Definition: The type(s) of location(s) associated with the travel personnel profile.

Definition: The code assigned to the city or town situated both within the Continental United States (CONUS) and non-foreign areas, i.e., a domestic location, in the travel personnel profile.
Authoritative and Other Source(s): Census, American National Standards Institute (ANSI) and Federal Information Processing Series (FIPS) Codes
Domain Values:
Use Census for city code: https://www.census.gov/library/reference/code-lists/ansi.html 

Scroll to the section "Place". Select "United States" from the dropdown menu. Download text file. Extract "PLACEFP". Also extract "STATEFP" because city codes are not unique across states 

NOTE: The Census city file contains city codes for both U.S. states and territories

Definition: The name of the city or town situated both within the Continental United States (CONUS) and non-foreign areas, i.e., a domestic location, in the travel personnel profile.

Traveler Profile

Definition: A name that identifies the type of telephone number.
Data Group Name:
Travel Personnel Baseline Profile;
Traveler Profile

Definition: A full domestic telephone number.
Data Group Name:
Travel Personnel Baseline Profile;
Traveler Profile
Element Format:
NXX-NXX-XXXX

where N is any digit from 2 through 9 and X is any digit from 0 through 9

Traveler Profile

Definition: Role(s) of a person with a responsibility to be executed during the travel and expense management process.
Domain Values: See Domain Values - TravelPersonnelRoles

Definition: An identifier that uniquely identifies the individual who incurred a reimbursable expense.
Authoritative and Other Source(s): Federal Travel Regulation Appendix C to Chapter 301—Standard Data Elements for Federal Travel

Definition: The form of payment identified by the travel personnel on how the agency will reimburse them for official business expenses.
Authoritative and Other Source(s): Federal Travel Regulation Appendix C to Chapter 301—Standard Data Elements for Federal Travel

Definition: The identifier for institutions within the financial services industry to facilitate automated processing of telecommunication messages in banking and related financial transaction environments.
Validations: Use SWIFT API for validation because they are the ISO registration authority: https://developer.swift.com/apis

Definition: The 9-digit account number assigned by the American Banking Association the financial institution has with the Federal Reserve.
Validations: Use LexisNexis Risk Solutions because they are ABA's Official Routing Number registrar: https://risk.lexisnexis.com/insights-resources/article/official-aba-registrar

Definition: The name of the financial institution associated with the routing transit number.
Validations:
If validating using the SWIFT code, use SWIFT API because they are the ISO registration authority: https://developer.swift.com/apis 

If validating using the Routing Transit Number, use LexisNexis Risk Solutions because they are ABA's Official Routing Number registrar: https://risk.lexisnexis.com/insights-resources/article/official-aba-registrar

Definition: The code associated with the bank account type that identifies the type of account.
Domain Values:
Checking;
Savings

Definition: An identifier that uniquely identifies an individual account at a specific financial institution in a particular country and which includes a bank identifier of the financial institution servicing that account.

An expanded version of the basic bank account number (BBAN), intended for use internationally, which uniquely identifies an individual account at a specific financial institution, in a particular country. Note 1 to entry: Although designed for use internationally, there is nothing to prevent the use of the IBAN domestically.
The traveler "employee" type for an individual authorized to travel or be reimbursed for official expenses at Government expense.
Data Group Name:
Travel Personnel Baseline Profile;
Traveler Profile

Definition: The five-digit postal code used by the United States Postal Service (USPS) for a location situated both within the Continental United States (CONUS) and non-foreign areas, i.e., a domestic location, associated with official travel.

Definition: Indicates that a transportation fare (e.g., airfare, train fare) is the lowest price evaluated against other comparable fares.
The type of lowest available fare evaluated against other comparable fares.

A codified notation recorded in the PNR that documents a stipulated airline fare against which comparison can be made to the actual fare booked and purchased. The basis for determining the most appropriate comparison fare varies according to the travel management objectives of the customer; however, comparison fares form the most basic metric for quantifying savings realized or lost in a given travel reservation.
The penalty dollar amount for cancellations or changes made to the original restricted fare ticket.
Alphanumeric code unique to a specific office of a travel agency associated with each booking in the PNR.
The number assigned to a Travel Management Company (TMC) to ensure that they get the appropriate discount.
Service Activity Reference(s):
TRT.010.020 Travel Reservation Assistance and Processing;

Definition: The 3-digit numeric Airline Reporting Corporation (ARC) code associated with the TMC's ticketing location for the related PNR.
Method by which a ticket is delivered to the traveler.

A code that enables airline and travel agents to retrieve the rules applicable to the associated booked or quoted fare. The characters, including order, can grant some indication of applicable terms, but not necessarily all of them. For instance, the first character is alpha and represents the associated booking class of service. Subsequent characters may indicate travel restrictions and/or booking requirements that may include advanced booking, minimum stays, days of week, season limitations, traveler type, among many other qualifiers.
Translation of the fare basis code for the type of common carrier or commercial transportation associated with a booked or quoted fare.
Translation of the fare basis code for the type of city-pair contract award associated with a booked or quoted fare.
Translation of the fare basis code for the cancelation policy associated with a booked or quoted fare.
Translation of the fare basis code for the type of seating class associated with a booked or quoted fare.
Translation of the fare basis code for the type of seating location associated with a booked or quoted fare.
The status of a ticket(s) during the travel process.
Authoritative and Other Source(s):
Federal Travel Regulation 301-72.301; 301-73.1, 301-73.2, 301-73.106;
Standard Form 1170, U.S. Federal Government Standard Form Redemption of Unused Tickets
